alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 16 at 3:49PM AKST until February 17 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 9 inches, highest near Whittier and Portage. East winds gusting 25 to 40 mph, highest through Portage Valley. * WHERE...Western Prince William Sound, including the Seward Highway corridor from eastern Turnagain Arm to Seward. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 9 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow will reduce visibility to one half mile or less at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The worst conditions are expected in Whittier, Portage Valley and east Turnagain Arm. Winds will not be as strong along the remainder of the Seward Highway corridor. The motion of vehicles along the highway can also serve to blow snow around and lower visibility.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
